name: httptest
description: A Test Environment for HTTP Requests in R
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
contribution_requirements_justification: There are no special requirements or standards beyond what is standard practice in the R community.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/nealrichardson/httptest/blob/master/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: https://github.com/nealrichardson/httptest/blob/master/DESCRIPTION#L20 The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: See https://enpiar.com/r/httptest/, https://enpiar.com/r/httptest/reference/, and vignettes including https://enpiar.com/r/httptest/articles/httptest.html
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: Every commit is on GitHub, not only those that are released.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
release_notes_justification: Non-trivial release notes file in repository: <https://github.com/nealrichardson/httptest/blob/master/NEWS.md>.
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: Private vulnerability reports are not supported.
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: There are no past vulnerability reports.
test_invocation_justification: Tests are executed by the standard method of checking R packages, `R CMD check`
tests_documented_added_justification: Given that line coverage is 100%, and that the purpose of this package is to facilitate testing, 100% line coverage is the expectation for any change.
warnings_justification: `R CMD check` thoroughly examines the package for consistency and validity, including tests, documentation, and example code. An additional spelling checker is run on top of those checks (https://github.com/nealrichardson/httptest/blob/master/tests/spelling.R). There is no automated linting.
warnings_fixed_justification: Travis builds fail and the package cannot be released to CRAN if any checks emit warnings.
warnings_strict_justification: Travis builds fail and the package cannot be released to CRAN if any checks emit warnings.
know_secure_design_justification: The primary security risk of this library is that users would inadvertently store their personal auth tokens from HTTP requests in public locations, and it has built in measures to prevent this by default and to enable further customization if needed: https://enpiar.com/r/httptest/articles/redacting.html
crypto_call_justification: It imports the `httr` and `curl` libraries for HTTP requesting, which are the standard in R.
static_analysis_justification: `R CMD check` performs a set of static analyses.
dynamic_analysis_justification: The test suite has 100% line coverage
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".

name: Ribamar
description: Ribamar is an open-source back-end application for managing user accounts, as well as authentication and authorization. Send confirmation e-mails; manage groups; store general user data and much more, all through a simple RESTful API.
contribution_justification: https://gitlab.com/riba-riba/ribamar#contributing
license_location_justification: https://gitlab.com/riba-riba/ribamar/blob/master/LICENSE
floss_license_justification: The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: https://gitlab.com/riba-riba/ribamar/wiki
repo_public_justification: https://gitlab.com/riba-riba/ribamar.git
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: We account NPM's built-in analysis tool to safe check all our dependencies.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: We use javascript through NodeJS, thus a memory-safe language.
crypto_weaknesses_justification: We encrypt the stored password using Iterative PBKDF over SHA-256.
discussion_justification: https://gitlab.com/riba-riba/ribamar/issues
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.
documentation_current_justification: There is a pipeline to check whether all important terms in the source code (functions, classes, global variables, modules etc...) appear at least a good amount times in the docs.
documentation_achievements_justification: Adding badges or related to GitLab project description or README. https://gitlab.com/riba-riba/ribamar
internationalization_justification: The application is mainly a back-end server which does not face humans in production.
sites_password_security_justification: We do not have a standalone site as of now.
coding_standards_justification:
We use ESLint to enforce most of our coding style.
https://gitlab.com/riba-riba/ribamar/wikis/contributing#guidelines
coding_standards_enforced_justification: We use ESLint to enforce most of our coding style.
automated_integration_testing_justificat: We have automated unit-tests executed at every commit through GitLab's CI.
test_statement_coverage80_justification: We have the tool (NYC) and the coverage rate.
input_validation_justification: All input data is validated against the NoSQL database enforced scheme.

name: ONAP DMaaP Buscontroller
description:
DMaaP Databus Controller API provides a provisioning API for clients of the data movement services (MR and DR) available in ONAP.
This API will create topics or feeds for clients who need to publish or subscriber.
contribution_justification: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Joining+the+Community https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Tracking+Issues+with+JIRA https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Developing+ONAP
contribution_requirements_justification:
https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Development+Procedures+and+Policies

The Java code should meet the requirement of Google Java Style - https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html except indents are 4 spaces and column limit is 120 which is described here: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Java+code+style Developer Best Practices: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Developer+Best+Practices
license_location_justification: https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap/dbcapi.git;a=blob;f=LICENSE.txt;h=b6c623b0a66864a6d2f0aaa28042e63a6144d16f;hb=0f2eac2ac51c3672b84c454c1f3a1208c8ba703d
floss_license_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: http://onap.readthedocs.io/en/beijing/submodules/dmaap/dbcapi.git/docs/api.html
repo_public_justification: https://gerrit.onap.org/r/#/admin/projects/dmaap/dbcapi
report_tracker_justification: Jira is used to track issues: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Tracking+Issues+with+JIRA
warnings_strict_justification: Build systems run the compile with test flag enabled by default. So any failure in test cases will fail the ci and the merge request.
static_analysis_often_justification: Jenkins CLM report (https://jenkins.onap.org/view/dmaap/job/dmaap-buscontroller-maven-clm-master/) is monitored and tasks assigned to remove identified issues.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: The code is written in Java, which is a memory-safe language
crypto_weaknesses_justification: All generated certificates are generated with sha256
hardening_justification: The project tries to use hardening mechanism whenever possible. Eg we use transaction id for tracking transactions through multiple services and also we use http headers to identify the application where possible
crypto_used_network_justification: The projects supports secure TLS and HTTPS and insecure protocols are disabled by default in these applications, they can be over-ridden by user configuration
crypto_certificate_verification_justific: Certificate validation is done before answering any calls.
crypto_verification_private_justificatio: The certificate is validated before sending http headers or private information.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
installation_common_justification: All packages are delivered either as an jar artifact or a docker image. In case of maven artifacts, they can be removed using the pom file. In case of docker container. We can delete the container we dont want. Also control the orchestration in Kubernetes if you want to exclude certain docker images.
dco_justification:
ONAP requires both a Developer Certificate of Origin (DCO), and a Contributor License Agreement (CLA).

https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Contribution+Agreements
e.g. of signed-off commit:  https://gerrit.onap.org/r/#/c/66789/
governance_justification:
The project governance is described at

https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Community+Offices+and+Governance

Further information can be found at https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/ONAP+Technical+Community+Document
roles_responsibilities_justification:
The key roles in the project and their responsibilities are described at

https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Community+Offices+and+Governance

Current members are listed at

https://wiki.onap.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=8226539
access_continuity_justification:
For dbcapi we have 2 committers and multiple contributers who are listed in
https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Resources+and+Repositories#ResourcesandRepositories-DataMovementasaPlatform
All 2 committers have access and rights to maintain the code base, approve and review incoming changes and release a new version of the artifact. This will let the project continue with minimal to no interruption if one person is incapacitated. 
Also this project is controlled by the linux foundation so we can add more committers if needed
bus_factor_justification:
All the projects covered in this report have more than 2 persons who actively contribute and maintain code. 
The following links provides with list of commit owners for the project which list at least two or more individuals: 
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/#/q/project:dmaap/dbcapi+branch:master
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/#/q/project:dmaap/buscontroller+branch:master
documentation_current_justification: Documentation is updated with each release.
documentation_achievements_justification: The badge is visible on the project's page here: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Data+Movement+as+a+Platform+Project
accessibility_best_practices_justificati:
The DMaaP Buscontroller project does not have any user interface. It exposes an API and fulfills a contract:
 https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap%2Fdbcapi.git;a=shortlog;h=HEAD
 https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap%2Fbuscontroller.git;a=shortlog;h=HEAD
internationalization_justification:
The DMaaP Buscontroller project does not have any user interface. It exposes an API and fulfills a contract:
 https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap%2Fdbcapi.git;a=shortlog;h=HEAD
 https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap%2Fbuscontroller.git;a=shortlog;h=HEAD
sites_password_security_justification: The project does not store passwords for authentication of external users
maintenance_or_update_justification: All major releases are tagged in gerrit and the artifacts are stored with the release information on onap.nexus. So we can access all old versions of the artifact. If and when a upgrade requires certain steps to be followed they are being added to the release documents as needed
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: Vulnerabilities can be reported using the link https://wiki.onap.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=6591711 Currently we dont have any vulnerabilities reported, but the wiki page explains on how to report a vulnerability and how to report anonymously if you do not want the credit for it.
coding_standards_justification: Project uses Google Java Style with changes explained here - https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Java+code+style
build_standard_variables_justification: The application does not create native binaries as it creates a jar.
build_non_recursive_justification: The application does not create native binaries as it creates a jar.
build_repeatable_justification: All releases are tagged in gerrit(git), and the builds are controlled using jenkins. By providing the git tag information the same image can be build over and over again with same bit-for-bit result.
installation_standard_variables_justific: The compiled docker images and jar files can be installed/used as the user sees fit. Both run on JVM or docker. So there is no reason to selecting locations etc.
installation_development_quick_justifica: The component requires only java and maven to begin with for a developer to quickly install and test it. Even for deployment using OOM and the right amount of resources, we can deploy the full DMaaP/ONAP suite in less than a day. The steps are documented in https://onap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/submodules/oom.git/docs/oom_quickstart_guide.html
external_dependencies_justification:
External dependencies are controlled using the pom file, which can be found in the root folder of each of the projects modules:
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap/dbcapi.git;a=blob;f=pom.xml;h=ece7ae0bf8c6f9cd36f7603d5ff89e6c22c5ef60;hb=c9016e789222c9512d484f296795ffa0a16bd7d7
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap/buscontroller.git;a=blob;f=pom.xml;h=5a2d435edc0cb7f9ac1642a646796c8d5a5108fa;hb=53eef7bbc76b4443877e5ab4a1bd10083335e41e
dependency_monitoring_justification:
NexusIQ sonar scan is run on the project on a weekly basis:
https://jenkins.onap.org/view/CLM/job/dmaap-dbcapi-maven-clm-master/
https://jenkins.onap.org/view/CLM/job/dmaap-buscontroller-maven-clm-master/
updateable_reused_components_justificati: External components are maintained through Maven. The user can get a list of all included components using the maven dependency tree and can update or reuse as they see fit
automated_integration_testing_justificat:
Automatic test suites are run every time before merging the code. The code check in cannot pass without jenkins posting a +1 on the review.
https://jenkins.onap.org/view/dmaap/job/dmaap-buscontroller-master-verify-java/
https://jenkins.onap.org/view/dmaap/job/dmaap-dbcapi-master-verify-java/
regression_tests_added50_justification: When regressions occur, we add tests for them.
test_statement_coverage80_justification:
We use sonar to measure the code coverage. 
https://sonar.onap.org/about
Code coverage at the date of filling this report(2018-10-23) is:
dbcapi: 52.2% line coverage
test_policy_mandated_justification: Contributing guide lines for development is recorded in: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Development+Procedures+and+Policies
implement_secure_design_justification: The project strives to implement secure design principles.
input_validation_justification: The project strives to validate all input to functions. The inputs that are provided to the services are checked against existing models such as OXM or search-abstraction layer and only valid inputs are allowed to be pass through
crypto_algorithm_agility_justification: Certificates are managed through AAF micro-service which will be deployed with ONAP suite
signed_releases_justification: All release artifacts are signed by the Linux Foundation prior to release.

repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.

release_notes_vulns_justification: there have been no publicly known vulnerabilities
report_responses_justification: Currently only solved and closed issues
enhancement_responses_justification: Currently only solved and closed issues
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: vulnerability reports should be posted as public issues
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: vulnerability reports should be posted as public issues
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: there has been no vulnerability report
build_justification: standard build infrastructure for R packages
build_common_tools_justification: standard build infrastructure for R packages
tests_are_added_justification: for example in https://github.com/daqana/dqrng/commit/757fdd1b95f8f532e0d03aa56695c9c08c705814 new functionality (a new RNG) was added including the corresponding test
tests_documented_added_justification: Currently only one developer, so coordination is trivial
warnings_fixed_justification: THere have been no warnings. The closest thing was a build FAILURE on Solaris, which was promptly fixed: https://github.com/daqana/dqrng/issues/1
warnings_strict_justification: Both Travis and Appveyor are run with "WARNINGS are ERRORS", which means that any WARNING produced by "R CMD check" is treated as a failure.
delivery_mitm_justification: CRAN uses HTTPS, GitHub HTTPS or SSH
static_analysis_justification: "R CMD check" does static code analysis
static_analysis_fixed_justification: None have been found so far.
static_analysis_often_justification: It is part of th eCI run done on every push
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: both locally and on CRAN, ASAN and valgrind are used
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: None have been found so far.

no_leaked_credentials_justification: The dployment key used to automatically update the documentation is encrypted using tools provided by Travis CI, c.f. https://github.com/daqana/dqrng/tree/master/.travis

vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: there have been no vulnerabilities resolved in the last 12 months

name: JHipster
description: Open Source application generator for creating Spring Boot + Angular/React projects in seconds!
interact_justification:
Help is at https://www.jhipster.tech/help/
Contributing is at https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
contribution_justification: https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
license_location_justification: https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/blob/master/LICENSE.txt
floss_license_justification: https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/blob/master/LICENSE.txt The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: https://www.jhipster.tech/
repo_public_justification: https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster.git
repo_track_justification: https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster.git
repo_interim_justification: We always use Pull Requests on GitHub, see https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aclosed
repo_distributed_justification: Yes we use Git
version_tags_justification: Each release on https://www.jhipster.tech/releases/ is linked to a Git tag, with the same version, that's part of the release process
release_notes_justification: Here are all our release notes: https://www.jhipster.tech/releases/
release_notes_vulns_justification:
We always tell those in our release notes at https://www.jhipster.tech/releases/
For example see https://www.jhipster.tech/2018/05/11/jhipster-release-4.14.4.html
report_responses_justification: See https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/issues - at the moment of this writing we have 36 open bugs out of 4,331 closed bugs. As you can see, we usually fix bugs in a matter of hours/days. If it's a major issue, we usually have a release in the following day.
enhancement_responses_justification: Same thing as above, see https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/labels/enhancement -> we have 5 enhancements requests open and 443 closed. They are usually done within a week.
report_archive_justification: We use the issue tracker for that https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/issues - everything is available and searchable there
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: See https://www.jhipster.tech/help/ -> usually people just submit a bug report, but sometimes if that's really urgent they contact us on Twitter
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: We don't have private vulnerability reports, everything is public on the project.
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: Usually we do this in the next day, never more than 3 days for sure.
build_justification: It's built with NPM/Yarn, and what we generate is built with Maven/Gradle (for the Java part) and NPM/Yarn (for the front-end part)
build_common_tools_justification: NPM/Yarn/Maven/Gradle are all very common tools
test_justification:
The full test suite is at https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/tree/master/test
But we do far better, with complete integration testing on Travis, and the code is at https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/tree/master/travis - the script at https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/blob/master/travis/build-samples.sh allow people to test the Travis build locally
test_most_justification: For the final tests (this includes the integration tests), Sonar says we have 84,5% of coverage at the date of this writing. The live report is at https://sonarcloud.io/dashboard?id=io.github.jhipster.sample%3Ajhipster-sample-application (it's re-generated with each commit)
test_policy_justification: It's requirement in https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submit and also the code must pass the Sonar quality gate at https://sonarcloud.io/dashboard?id=io.github.jhipster.sample%3Ajhipster-sample-application
tests_are_added_justification: We don't allow major features without tests. Anyway it wouldn't pass the Sonar quality gate at https://sonarcloud.io/dashboard?id=io.github.jhipster.sample%3Ajhipster-sample-application
warnings_justification: We have a lint in our test suite at https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/tree/master/test - it's just not possible to pass the tests (that's the first test in our Travis test) if there is a lint error
warnings_fixed_justification: We don't allow warnings, see the above section about the "lint", it can't go pass the tests, so the PR will not be processed
warnings_strict_justification: We are very strict and don't allow them at all
know_secure_design_justification:
I'm the lead developer so I'm the primary developer. I've got 20 years of experience, worked for several very high security systems (including several software for the French central bank), and I am a Java Champion (see https://community.oracle.com/community/technology_network_community/java/java-champions ).
In the core team we also have Matt Raible, who is also a Java Champion, and who works for https://www.okta.com/
know_common_errors_justification: As written above, me & Matt Raible are worldwide recognized experts in that field.
crypto_published_justification: As you can see in https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/blob/master/generators/server/templates/src/main/java/package/security/jwt/TokenProvider.java.ejs we use `java.security.Key` as well as strong encryption provided by https://github.com/jwtk/jjwt for securing our tokens. FYI the algorithm is HMAC-SHA-512. This is done with the help of Okta, where Matt Raible and the lead JJWT developer both work.
crypto_call_justification: See above, that's the case in https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/blob/master/generators/server/templates/src/main/java/package/security/jwt/TokenProvider.java.ejs
crypto_keylength_justification:
That's provided by https://github.com/jwtk/jjwt - the library will fail if you provide a key which is too short. So for HMAC-SHA-512 (our algorithm) this is 512 bytes.
And if the library fails our software does not start, of course.
crypto_working_justification: This is HMAC-SHA-512 and that's not broken yet
crypto_pfs_justification: This doesn't make sense for us, this is for securing a webapp and the default validity for a key is 30 minutes...
crypto_password_storage_justification: Yes, when a password is stored, it is hashed with Bcrypt, see https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/blob/4623dea96ad39d561732d422351674b11b415e4c/generators/server/templates/src/main/java/package/config/SecurityConfiguration.java.ejs#L193
crypto_random_justification:
We use the crypto function from NodeJS to generate the key, see https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/blob/4a3184ae352cec0a26f696d75a4c34992552a654/generators/server/prompts.js#L288
But we recommend our users to generate their own key and not use this one, which is just there for development purpose
delivery_mitm_justification: We provide full documentation and support for TLS, see https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/blob/v5.2.1/generators/server/templates/src/main/resources/config/application-prod.yml.ejs#L206
delivery_unsigned_justification: If you follow our documentation above, this is not possible as you use TLS
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: You can check at https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/issues there's nothing at the moment
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: Usually we do this 1 to 3 days after a vulnerability
static_analysis_justification: After each commit we have a Sonar analysis on https://sonarcloud.io/dashboard?id=io.github.jhipster.sample%3Ajhipster-sample-application
static_analysis_fixed_justification: Yes that's what we do, and in the https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=io.github.jhipster.sample%3Ajhipster-sample-application&resolved=false&types=VULNERABILITY report it's currently empty, with an empty history (and they keep track for the last 30 days)
static_analysis_often_justification: That's on every commit, this is automatically run by Travis with this script: https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/blob/v5.2.1/travis/scripts/06-sonar.sh
dynamic_analysis_justification: We use OWASP with each major release, even if the tool is pretty bad
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: We use JavaScript so that should be good
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: I'm pretty sure OWASP does this
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: Yes but OWASP never found anything
crypto_weaknesses_justification: This is HMAC-SHA-512 and it's good as of now
discussion_justification: https://github.com/jhipster/generator-jhipster/issues
no_leaked_credentials_justification: There's no such thing in our GitHub repo. Yes there are sample credentials, but they are only there to show how things work, and they are documented as such.
english_justification: Everything we do is in English. See https://www.jhipster.tech/help/ for example.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".

name: vipster
description: Visualization of various molecular structure files.
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
contribution_requirements_justification:
C++ coding standards and styles are numerous.
This project has parts that use Qt and try to adhere to their standards, and parts that shall be self-sufficient and stray from Qt-conventions where deemed appropriate.
Contributors shall use what they see fit for the part they contribute to.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/sgsaenger/vipster/blob/master/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The GPL-3.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The GPL-3.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: https://sgsaenger.github.io/vipster/about.html
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: All development is done public on GitHub.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_tags_justification: Releases are created from git tags, therefore they are directly synchronized.
test_most_justification: Most functionality is contained in libvipster, which is continually monitored.
tests_are_added_justification: Coverage is tracked for commits and pull-requests
tests_documented_added_justification: Negative changes in coverage will be marked in pull-requests
know_secure_design_justification:
Single user program that is designed to transform text files in other text files.
Security and access handled by standard OS dependent interfaces.
delivery_mitm_justification: Applies only to distribution; handled through GitHub.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
implementation_languages: C++, C, JavaScript, QML, GLSL, Objective-C
